pageContext.claim: “We have created the envy of the world and will soon be landing on Mars, and will soon have the greatest weapons ever imagined in history. I've already seen designs. And even I can't believe it.”
pageContext.analysis: The United States will not "soon" be landing on Mars, that's years away. Even a moon landing by 2024 is considered a stretch. As for "greatest weapons," we believe Trump is referring to what he once called a "super-duper" weapon. These are hypersonic weapons, namely hypersonic glide vehicles (HGV) that can reach speeds of at least Mach 5, or roughly 3,800 mph. Trump has previously called these the fastest missiles ever made but that's wrong. They are not faster than US nuclear-armed intercontinental-range ballistic missiles.
